experience: You and Ronald both know Mike Hawksworth, Tommy Schaeffer, and 12 others
Ronald can introduce you to 10 people at Capgemini
Our HIRING practices are backwards! ATS's weed out candidates before employers even get to know them.
HR Managers, recruiters - This is why you can’t find the right people. The qualities you need are not on a resume.
You really need to be looking for human qualities. EI, Humility, Ingenuity, Drive, Knowledge, Experience. Only human interaction can pick up these traits.
"It gets frustrating trying to get my resume through the electronic screening process. I know I can knock their socks off if I could just talk to a real person."
BA or MBA required? Worse yet, if you have an EMPLOYMENT GAP or you are OVERQUALIFIED.
Someone’s experience and skills should not be discounted because of personal circumstances which were entirely out of their control.
Furthermore, not hiring a mature worker is like throwing away a library full of books every 50 yrs. What a waste of knowledge and talent.
My father was a erratic alcoholic.

Throughout my childhood he would purchase, then proceed to throw away, various television sets. He viewed television as a waste of time and his self-loathing after spending an afternoon on the couch affected all of us.
It was a blessing and a curse. As a middle child, I retreated into literature. I read. Everything.
At 7 I finished Les Misérables. By 8th grade I tested at college level reading comprehension.

My “success” on this platform is in no way related to my personal business savvy, or financial or social gain. It's purely a result of my ability to write, gleaned from a life of hiding away from my father’s rage.
That being said, I am no better or different than any of you. We are a product of our circumstances.
I know successful people are viewed differently. Possibly glorified.
But our successes and failures are so often ingrained. And sometimes they come from dark places.
What is your source of success?
Boss: But works starts at 9 am.
Isn't this scenario familiar? I've always wondered why bosses don't complain when you leave late but count every minute you come in late?
The above was a reference from a chat I recently had with a friend who was having issues with her boss' expectations.
Personally, I always support flexibility as long as it doesn't affect your work ethic, productivity & commitments.
Work-needs also depend on your industry - If you work in large organizations serving specific time zones, timing can be key. Startups are usually more lenient.
However, a lot of managers perceive "quantity" as an indicator of "performance" rather than "quality"- A perception that surely needs a shift.
Now, I'm not arguing the importance of facetime. In fact, facetime with your team is key to cultivating relationships.
What's important is the balance between micromanagement & flexibility.
HBR quotes a study that suggests - The more confidence managers have in their people, the better they perform.
Instead of making time the success indicator, define the parameters of what success looks like for a job & make that the measuring stick.

I focus on 3-4 families in our neighborhood whom we are to visit and help them if there is anything they need.  I help with record-keeping, and visiting families, teaching those in the neighbor that may need help.  We are placed on this earth, I believe, to help those in need.  "God", our Father in Heaven, can't do it all alone.  He meets our needs, most often, through the actions of others.  Have you ever had the feeling "just go to so&so's house NOW!"  You figure, "yes, I have not seen them for a while.  You knock on the door, and they say "How did you know we needed help!?"I have.  It's more rewarding than anything I have experience at work.

summary: Brings talent, experience, excellent spatial skills, 'Politically-unmotivated' thought processes, applying 'out-of-the-box', to create/implement Oracle Cloud, EBS, or System Solutions! Reducing Custom code by 20+%  =  Not only from a software perspective but from a Business Process perspective:●     Collaboratively shares strong business acumen,  personality, and a broad background in business consulting, technology application, and project management to help reduce complexity saving you and your team(s) $6+ million annually ●     Speaks Chinese = 1 less opportunity for misunderstanding.●     Immediately applicable, "hands-on", management-level experience in Operations, Supply Chain, Agricultural operations, and Distribution management = reduced inventory 20+% ●    Relentlessly focused on Customer care = increased Fill-rates > 13% & customer satisfaction 10+%●    Utilizes AGILE Project Management, bringing together multiple, different, consulting teams to cut ORDER/QUOTING times by 50%●    Streamlining business processes allowing multiple implementations in months, not yearsAVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY TO HELP YOU AND YOUR TEAM(S) WITH: ■     Oracle E-Business & Cloud/Fusion Applications-based Solutions MFG, PLM, SCM, WMS, CTO & CPQ■     Improving Fill-rate & Quality Delivery performance (quicker customer response & fulfillment rates)■     Engages teams with AGILE/SCRUM to expedite, improve END-USER buy-in and reducing complexity ■     Greater productivity through lower costs and higher efficiency■     Reducing inventory throughout the supply chain where needed (total cost of quality & lost customers)■      Improving quality and Customer satisfaction■     Speaking the CUSTOMERS', your customer's, and their customer's Language.  It's about your Supply Chain (not just your Purchasing department)!
